rooms.description: A spacious entrance area designed to welcome guests, integrating elements of Chettinad style with traditional motifs and durable local materials.
The living space is open-plan, featuring large windows for natural light, and includes a dedicated section for wheelchair accessibility, ensuring ease of movement throughout the room.

A separate home office area integrated within the living space to promote productivity while maintaining a peaceful environment. The design respects privacy through subtle spatial divisions using traditional screens.
An ergonomic kitchen designed following local building norms, with wheelchair-friendly counter heights and accessible storage solutions, incorporating Chettinad motifs in decor.
Adjacent to the kitchen, a dining area that is spacious enough for family gatherings, complementing the overall design aesthetic.
A modern yet traditional bathroom designed with accessible features such as grab bars and wheelchair-accessible fixtures, keeping in mind Vastu principles regarding water placement.

openings.description: The main entrance is positioned at the corner to optimize natural light and align with Vastu principles while ensuring easy access for wheelchair users via a ramped entry.
Large windows placed strategically to enhance cross ventilation and maximize daylight, ensuring energy efficiency and adherence to local building norms.
A balcony space overlooking the swimming pool area, providing a seamless connection between indoor and outdoor living while maintaining privacy.
Accessible path to an integrated swimming pool designed with safety features and easy wheelchair movement.
